posts.post_content:
@HairlessThoctar  
  
It's hardly the first blue trampler...  
  
[Deep Spawn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deep Spawn)  
[Emberwilde Caliph](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emberwilde Caliph)  
[Firestorm Hellkite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Firestorm Hellkite)  
[Fungal Shambler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fungal Shambler)  
[Leviathan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leviathan)  
[Polar Kraken](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Polar Kraken)  
[Silver Erne](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Silver Erne) (honestly, the first one I thought of...probably because of the combination of flying *and* trample at that time)  
[Taniwha](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Taniwha) (another bizarre ability combo)  
  
...and it's hardly been the last...  
  
[Assault Zeppelid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Assault Zeppelid)  
[Blood Tyrant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blood Tyrant)  
[Bringer of the Blue Dawn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bringer of the Blue Dawn)  
[Child of Alara](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Child of Alara)  
[Horde of Notions](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Horde of Notions)  
[Inkwell Leviathan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inkwell Leviathan)  
[Jokulmorder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jokulmorder)  
[Mindleech Mass](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mindleech Mass)  
[Simic Sky Swallower](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Simic Sky Swallower)  
  
...and a few can get the ability when cast, even if they don't have it printed...  
  
[Academy Researchers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Academy Researchers) (I prefer it... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
In case you guys didn't know.  
T3: [Long-Forgotten Gohei](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Long-Forgotten Gohei)  
T4: [Reach Through Mists](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reach Through Mists), [Peer Through Depths](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Peer Through Depths), [Sift Through Sands](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sift Through Sands)  
BAM! free [The Unspeakable](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=The Unspeakable) a 7/8 Flying Trampling monstrosity for only a 6 mana investment that you can attack with by turn 5

posts.post_content: Try Blessed Breath, an arcane spell that gives a creature protection. You keep The Unspeakable alive and he will return Blessed Breath back to your hand over and over.

Posted By: Cyberium (3/6/2011 12:03:57 AM)
Rating:

@sly92: That "weird mustache" you're referring to ... that wouldn't happen to be its mouth?

And regarding the art, I like it. It's a twisted abomination with no heart (at least I'm pretty sure), which is why it looks so weird and has that hole in its chest.
Another thing I like about The Unspeakable is that it can pick up Reach Through Mists, Peer Through Depths and Sift Through Sands from your graveyard again once you start swining, which can be pretty useful in case your opponent decides to aim removal at its face.
